1.text: Call now, if there be any that will answer you; and to which of the saints will you turn?

2.text: For wrath kills the foolish man, and envy slays the silly one.

3.text: I have seen the foolish taking root: but suddenly I cursed his habitation.

4.text: His children are far from safety, and they are crushed in the gate, neither is there any to deliver them.

5.text: Whose harvest the hungry eats up, and takes it even out of the thorns, and the robber swallows up their substance.

6.text: Although affliction comes not forth of the dust, neither does trouble spring out of the ground;

7.text: Yet man is born to trouble, as the sparks fly upward.

8.text: I would seek to God, and to God would I commit my cause:

9.text: Which does great things and unsearchable; marvelous things without number:

10.text: Who gives rain on the earth, and sends waters on the fields:

11.text: To set up on high those that be low; that those which mourn may be exalted to safety.

12.text: He disappoints the devices of the crafty, so that their hands cannot perform their enterprise.

13.text: He takes the wise in their own craftiness: and the counsel of the fraudulent is carried headlong.

14.text: They meet with darkness in the day time, and grope in the noonday as in the night.

15.text: But he saves the poor from the sword, from their mouth, and from the hand of the mighty.

16.text: So the poor has hope, and iniquity stops her mouth.

17.text: Behold, happy is the man whom God corrects: therefore despise not you the chastening of the Almighty:

18.text: For he makes sore, and binds up: he wounds, and his hands make whole.

19.text: He shall deliver you in six troubles: yes, in seven there shall no evil touch you.

20.text: In famine he shall redeem you from death: and in war from the power of the sword.

21.text: You shall be hid from the whip of the tongue: neither shall you be afraid of destruction when it comes.

22.text: At destruction and famine you shall laugh: neither shall you be afraid of the beasts of the earth.

23.text: For you shall be in league with the stones of the field: and the beasts of the field shall be at peace with you.

24.text: And you shall know that your tabernacle shall be in peace; and you shall visit your habitation, and shall not sin.

25.text: You shall know also that your seed shall be great, and your offspring as the grass of the earth.

26.text: You shall come to your grave in a full age, like as a shock of corn comes in in his season.

27.text: See this, we have searched it, so it is; hear it, and know you it for your good.
